restlib.net

Class TagBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • restlib.net.TagBuilder

  • @NotThreadSafe
public final class TagBuilder
extends Object
    A builder for minting Tag URI objects. TagBuilder instances can be reused; it is safe to call build() multiple times to build multiple Tags.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public Uri build()
        Returns a new tag Uri instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the Tag instance that would be generated by this builder is not a syntactically valid URI or if the authority name component of the tag is undefined.

      • setAuthorityName

        public TagBuilder setAuthorityName(InetAddress authorityName)
        Sets the authority name component of the TagBuilder from an InetAddress.

        Note: the tag authority name component is a path segment not the URI authority.

        Parameters:
        authorityName - any valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if authorityName is null.

      • setAuthorityName

        public TagBuilder setAuthorityName(InternetDomainName authorityName)
        Sets the authority name component of the TagBuilder from an InternetDomainName.

        Note: the tag authority name component is a path segment not the URI authority.

        Parameters:
        authorityName - any valid Internet domain name.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if authorityName is null.

      • setAuthorityName

        public TagBuilder setAuthorityName(String authorityName)
        Sets the authority name component of the TagBuilder.

        Note: the tag authority name component is a path segment not the URI authority.

        Parameters:
        authorityName - a URI encoded authority name string.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if authorityName is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if authorityName is not a valid URI encoded Tag authority name.

      • setDate

        public TagBuilder setDate(int year)
        Sets the date that Tag's built by this TagBuilder will be minted on.
        Parameters:
        year - the 4 digit year the tag should be minted on.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if year is not a valid 4 digit year,.

      • setDate

        public TagBuilder setDate(int year,
                 int month)
        Sets the date that Tag's built by this TagBuilder will be minted on.
        Parameters:
        year - the 4 digit year the tag should be minted on.
        month - the 2 digit month the tag should be minted on.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if year is not a valid 4 digit year, or if month is not a valid 2 digit month.

      • setDate

        public TagBuilder setDate(int year,
                 int month,
                 int day)
        Sets the date that Tag's built by this TagBuilder will be minted on.
        Parameters:
        year - a 4 digit year the tag should be minted on.
        month - a 2 digit month the tag should be minted on, or -1 to indicate no month.
        day - a 2 digit day the tag should be minted on or -1 to indicate no day.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if year is not a valid 4 digit year, or if month is not a valid 2 digit month, or if day is not a valid 2 digit day.

      • setDate

        public TagBuilder setDate(long datetime)
        Sets the date that the Uri built by this TagBuilder will be minted on.
        Parameters:
        datetime - the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.
        Returns:
        This TagBuilder instance.

      • setFragment

        public TagBuilder setFragment(String fragment)
        Sets the fragment component of the TagBuilder.
        Parameters:
        fragment - a URI encoded fragment string.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if fragment is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if fragment contains characters not allowed in the URI fragment component.

      • setSpecificPath

        public TagBuilder setSpecificPath(Path path)
        Sets the specific path component of the TagBuilder.
        Parameters:
        path - a Path instance that is a valid URI path.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if path is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if path is not a valid URI path.

      • setSpecificPath

        public TagBuilder setSpecificPath(String path)
        Sets the specific path component of the TagBuilder.
        Parameters:
        path - a String instance that is a valid URI path.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if path is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if path is not a valid URI path.

      • setSpecificQuery

        public TagBuilder setSpecificQuery(String query)
        Sets the specific query component of the TagBuilder.
        Parameters:
        query - A URI encoded query string.
        Returns:
        this TagBuilder instance.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if query is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if query contains characters not allowed in the URI query component.
